title: Wildlife Photography Walk
summary: Learn composition and camera basics while spotting animals on the trail.
accessibility: Outdoor paths. Benches available. Suitable for beginners.
details: Bring a phone or camera. Weâ€™ll cover lighting, focus, and respectful wildlife viewing.

title: Conservation Q&A Talk
summary: Ask questions about habitats, biodiversity, and local conservation projects.
accessibility: Indoor seating and hearing-friendly seating at the front.
details: A short talk followed by open Q&A with our conservation team.

title: Mini Rangers Club
summary: A fun session with badges: tracks, habitats, and animal facts.
accessibility: Quiet corner available. Activities can be adapted.
details: Children earn a sticker badge and complete a simple activity sheet.

title: Bug Safari
summary: Explore mini-beasts safely with magnifiers and observation trays.
accessibility: Flat viewing area. Staff assist with handling rules.
details: We observe, identify, then return everything safely to nature.

title: Relaxed Visit (Low Sensory)
summary: A quieter session with reduced noise and smaller groups.
accessibility: Low-sensory approach, step-free routes, staff support available.
details: Ideal for visitors who prefer calm environments. Visual guide available at reception.

title: Accessible Guided Route
summary: A staff-led route focusing on step-free paths and rest stops.
details: We move at a comfortable pace and stop often for viewing and questions.
